title.narrative: BD Dhaka Water Supply and Sanitation Project

description.narrative: The revised Project Development Objective is to improve stormwater drainage in select catchments in Dhaka and improve DWASA's planning activity.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :FA. Sch. 2, Sect. I, A.1 | Description :The Recipient shall, by no later than 3 months after the Effective date,establish an interministerial Project Steering Committee, in form and with composition agreed with the Association | Due Date:17-Jun-2009

Finance Agreement :FA. Sch. 2, Sect. III, F.1 | Description :The Recipient shall implement a Procurement Risk Mitigation Framework(PRMF) and submit quarterly reports detailing the procurementprocess, the PRMF and quality of goods, services and works | Frequency:Quarterly

Finance Agreement :FA. Sch. 2, Sect. III, F.2 | Description :The Recipient shall appoint an International Procurement consultant toprovide oversight on the procurement process of the 2 major pumping stations | Due Date :30-Jun-2009
Finance Agreement :PA. Schedule, Sect. I, A.1 | Description :DWASA shall, by no later than 3 months after the Effective date,establish a Project Management Unit | Due Date :17-Jun-2009
Finance Agreement :PA. Schedule, Sect. I, A.2 | Description :DWASA shall constitute a Project Audit Committee | Due Date:30-Jun-2009

Finance Agreement :PA. Schedule, Sect. II, C.1 | Description :DWASA shall, not later than 6 months after the closing of its fiscalyear, furnish to the Association the results of the annual financial and technical audit of the Performance Agreement | Frequency:Yearly
Finance Agreement :PA. Schedule, Sect. IV. 3 | Description :DWASA shall maintain a ratio of current assets to current liabilitiesof not less than 1.2 | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :PA. Schedule, Sect. IV. 3 | Description :DWASA shall take all necessary measures to achieve a positive netincome | Due Date :30-Jun-2013
